body:
Comment 9 by **lucio.dere**: 
Rob, note that the problem actually lies with an unfinished implementation of the
GO386=387 architecture; NetBSD just happens to be the platform I identified it on.

I mention in one of the reports that Ubuntu also shows the signs and that the current,
partial fix gets rid of it.

I don't like the answer, it highlights the added dimension of CPU-versions to what is
already a very complex portability problem, but in this case it needs to be resolved and
fortunately the solution is fairly simple.

Lucio.
